oracle.cloudstorage.ftm.exception

Class NotEnoughSpaceInTempDir

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Throwable
      • java.lang.Exception
        • java.lang.RuntimeException
          • oracle.cloudstorage.ftm.exception.ClientException
            • oracle.cloudstorage.ftm.exception.NotEnoughSpaceInTempDir
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Serializable
    Deprecated. 
    As of release 2.1

    @Deprecated
public class NotEnoughSpaceInTempDir
extends ClientException
    Not enough space is available in temporary directory for file transfer.

    Each active large file upload needs a temporary space for storing the segments to be uploaded. At a time for each upload, maximum space required can be computed as follows:

  • maxThreadsPerLargeObjectTransfer * segmentSize

    Both of the above parameters can be configured via uploadConfig parameter for each file upload.

    Each active large object download needs a temporary space for storing all the segments of the object before they are written to the destination file. For each large file download, the temporary space required is same as the object size.

See Also:
